str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Compound of heros and eidos; heroic; Herod, the name of four Jewish kings.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kratos; to use strength, i.e. Seize or retain.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To bind, tie, fasten; I impel, compel; I declare to be prohibited and unlawful. A primary verb; to bind.
From phulasso; a guarding or, the act, the person; figuratively, the place, the condition, or, the time, literally or figuratively.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
From philos and hippos; fond of horses; Philippus, the name of four Israelites.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
From Herodes; Herodias, a woman of the Heodian family.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To marry, used of either sex. From gamos; to wed.
